title: Transgender Teacher Wins Excellent Teacher Award

content.en: A math teacher from Chiayi has won an excellent teacher award. She is the first transgender person to win!
content.tw: 嘉義一位數學老師得到最佳教師獎，她是第一個得獎的跨性別老師。

content.en: When we are born, a doctor looks at us. The doctor says (doctor's voice) "It's a boy!" or "It's a girl!" But later, some boys feel like a girl. Some girls feel like a boy. The feeling doesn't go away.
content.tw: 當我們出生時，醫生馬上就會說我們是男生或是女生。但有一些人覺得自己是其他性別，而這個感覺會一直存在。

content.en: When this teacher was born, her doctor said she was a boy. She looked like a boy. But later, the teacher felt like a girl in a boy's body. That's because the teacher is transgender.
content.tw: 出生時，醫生說這個老師是男生，但她一直覺得自己其實是女生，只是住在男生的身體裡，因為她是跨性別者。

content.en: As a child, the teacher didn't tell anyone how she felt. She worried people would laugh at her. She worried they wouldn't believe her.
content.tw: 小時候，她不敢告訴任何人，她擔心其他人會嘲笑，或是不相信她。

content.en: As an adult, the teacher told everyone how she felt. Her friends and family were happy for her! But she worried about her job. Then she found her students and their parents were happy for her too!
content.tw: 長大後，這位老師才坦承自己的感受，家人朋友都很支持她! 她一度很擔心自己的工作，但她發現學生跟家長們也都替她開心!

content.en: This teacher teaches math. But she also helps transgender people understand their feelings. She helps students and other teachers too.
content.tw: 現在這位老師除了教數學，也幫助其他的學生、老師，以及跨性別的人了解自己的感受。

content.en: She really is an excellent teacher!
content.tw: 她真是一位優秀的老師！

vocabulary.preface: 這位跨性別老師善於幫助學生，還獲得優良教師獎。

content.text:
1. look like 看起來像。
Do I look like a panda? 我看起來像不像熊貓?
With the dark circles under your eyes? 因為你的黑眼圈嗎?
No, you have no fur. 不像，你沒有皮毛。

2. feel 感覺。
Good! I've only had 2 hours of sleep. 真好。我只睡了兩個鐘頭。
I feel like I could fall asleep any time. 我覺得隨時都會睡著。

3. understand 了解。
Watching TV series again? 你又在追劇?
Yeah, I just couldn't stop.對，就是停不下來。
I totally understand. 我完全了解。

4. girl 女孩。
I've been watching a program about a boy and two girls.
我在追一個男孩跟兩個女孩的劇。
I can't stop either. 我也停不下來。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字你記住了幾個?
look like看起來像 feel感覺 understand了解 girl女孩

quiz.question: 1. What does the teacher teach?
2. What award did the teacher win?
3. What is the teacher now?

content.en: Looking for something special is exciting! A very special thing can be a treasure. Looking for it is a treasure hunt.
content.tw: 尋找非常特別又稀有的東西，叫做尋寶!

content.en: Treasure hunts have maps or puzzles. People find answers to the puzzles … Aha! The answers help them find the treasure!
content.tw: 尋寶的時候會有地圖或難題，解開難題後就能找到寶藏!

content.en: A treasure hunt started in 1993. The treasure is an owl. It's made of gold, silver, and diamonds! It was somewhere in France.
content.tw: 尋寶活動開始是在1993年。寶藏是一隻用金、銀跟鑽石做成的貓頭鷹，寶藏是在法國的某個地方。

content.en: A man made eleven puzzles. It took four hundred and fifty hours! He put the puzzles in a book. Thousands of people read it. They tried to find the answers. They wanted to find the golden owl!
content.tw: 一個男人花了 450 個小時，設計了 11 道難題，好幾千人很想找到貓頭鷹，拼命地解那些謎題!

content.en: The man said finding the owl might take a few months. Two years later, he said finding it might take two hours. But everyone had to share their answers!
content.tw: 那個男人說找到貓頭鷹要花好幾個月，兩年後，他說大家要是互相分享自己的答案，只要兩個小時就可以找到了。

content.en: The man died in 2009. But people didn't stop looking. They looked for 31 years! Then someone found the owl! The treasure hunt is done! Many people are happy!
content.tw: 那個男人在 2009 年過世，但其他人沒有放棄寶藏，他們總共找了 31 年，終於有人找到寶藏了!耶!!

content.en: The golden owl is worth about five million Taiwan dollars! Whoa! What a treasure!
content.tw: 這隻金貓頭鷹價值約五百萬新台幣！哇！真是個寶藏！

vocabulary.preface: 用金銀珠寶打造的貓頭鷹雕像，多年來讓很多尋寶人大傷腦筋!

content.text:
1. look for 尋找。
I would never spend years looking for some treasure.
我絕對不會花幾年的時間去尋寶。
Why not? It could be a lot of fun. 為什麼不? 也許很好玩呢。

2. find 找到。
It's fun only if you can find it. 你找到了才好玩。
I would always worry that it's a scam. 我會一直擔心是個騙局。

3. gold 黃金。
A treasure box full of gold, silver and diamonds? 寶貝箱裡裝滿了金銀鑽石?
That's only in movies. 那只有電影裡才有。

4. hundred 百。
I want to find a sunken ship if I can. 可能的話我想找到一艘沈船。
A ship that sank hundreds of years ago. 幾百年前沉沒的船。

vocabulary.postscript:
Will you join a treasure hunt? 一起來讀單字。
look for尋找 find找到 gold黃金 hundred百

quiz.question: 1. Where was the owl?
2. How long was the treasure hunt?
3. How much is the owl worth?

title: Fish See Themselves in the Mirror

content.en: When you look in a mirror, you see yourself. You know it's you. Do fish know themselves? Knowing themselves means fish are smart. Scientists wanted to find out. So they gave some fish the mirror test.
content.tw: 照鏡子的時候，你知道鏡子裡的人是自己，魚可以認出鏡子裡的自己嗎？認的出，就代表魚很聰明，所以科學家做了實驗。

content.en: Here's how the mirror test works. Scientists put a very small mark on each fish. The fish could not see the mark. Then the scientists showed the fish themselves in a mirror.
content.tw: 科學家在每一隻魚身上畫了一個標記，但是魚自己看不到。接著，科學家給牠們照鏡子。

content.en: One by one, each fish looked in the mirror. Each saw a fish. Each saw the mark. Then each tried to make the mark go away. The fish knew themselves!
content.tw: 結果，每一條魚照鏡子後都想把身上的標記弄掉。牠們明白鏡子裡的魚是自己!

content.en: An excited scientist said, "This is the coolest thing!" But some scientists thought the test was broken! Why? They thought fish could not be smart. But fish are smart!
content.tw: 科學家興奮地說：「這真是太酷了！」雖然也有一些科學家不相信，但是魚真的這麼聰明!

content.en: It's important to learn about fish. Fish are the animals we eat the most. Fish are the pets we have the most. Fish are the animals scientists use for research the most. And now we know they are smart!
content.tw: 了解魚類很重要，因為在所有動物中，魚類是我們最常吃的，也養魚當寵物，或者用牠們做實驗。現在我們知道牠們智商滿高的!

content.en: These smart fish do a lot for us. It's important to be good to them!
content.tw: 這些聰明的魚對我們幫助很大。對牠們好很重要！

vocabulary.preface: 科學家用了一些實驗證明，魚可能有自我的意識。

content.text: 1. yourself 你自己。 I don't know if fish are smart, 我不知道魚聰不聰明， but they taste really good! 不過牠真的很好吃! I agree. Do you cook fish yourself? 我同意。你自己做魚料理嗎? Sure.當然。
2. try 嘗試。 I always try to do it the easiest way. 我總是用最簡單的辦法。 Just add some salt, wine and garlic, and bake it. 加一點鹽，酒和大蒜，烤一烤。
3. learn 學習。 I'd like to learn it from you.我要跟你學。 No problem. I can record it and send it to you.沒問題，我可以拍下來寄給你。
4. excited 開心的。 That will be great! I'm excited! 真棒，我好開心! Finally I'll show my mom I can cook.終於可以給我媽媽看我會做菜。

vocabulary.postscript: Do you like eating fish? 來讀今天的單字。 yourself你自己 try嘗試 learn學習 excited開心的

quiz.question: 1. What test did scientists use on some fish?
2. What are the animals we eat the most?
3. What's important to do for fish?

title: Turkeys and Little Green Men Make Crossing Streets Safer

content.en: When you walk across the street, you look at the traffic light, right? It tells you when it's safe to cross.
content.tw: 過馬路時，我們都會看交通號誌，它會告訴我們甚麼時候可以安全過馬路。

content.en: But many people look at their phones. They wait and look at their phones. They cross the street and look at their phones. That's so dangerous!
content.tw: 但很多人會一直看手機，在過馬路時，眼睛也緊緊黏在手機上。非常危險!

content.en: In Chiayi, there are fun traffic lights! They're in five places. When the light is red, you see... a turkey! When the light is green, you see a bowl of turkey rice. That's a Chaiyi dish.
content.tw: 嘉義有一個很有趣的交通號誌。紅燈時我們會看到火雞!綠燈時則會看到嘉義最有名的火雞肉飯。

content.en: Taiwan has other places with fun traffic lights! In Taipei, a little green man runs faster and faster.
content.tw: 很多地方都有特色的交通號誌。像是台北的小綠人就跑的超級快。

content.en: In Pingtung, the little green man crosses the street with his girlfriend. When the light turns red, he asks his girlfriend to marry him. Some lights show the little green man with a family.
content.tw: 在屏東，小綠人和女朋友一起走，紅燈時，他會跪下來向女朋友求婚。有一些地方的號誌則是小綠綠全家人。

content.en: The traffic lights are fun. But they have an important job. They help stop people from looking at their phones. They make people want to look at the lights!
content.tw: 這些好玩的交通號誌有個任務，就是讓人不要只盯著手機，而是注意看號誌。

content.en: Turkeys and little green men make crossing the street fun - and safe - in Taiwan!
content.tw: 火雞和小綠人讓在台灣過馬路變得有趣又安全！

vocabulary.preface: 行人號誌越做越有趣，好吸引行人專心過馬路。

content.text: 1. turn 變成。 The light is about to turn red! Let's run! 快變成紅燈了，快跑! Oh, boy, that was close! 只差一點點。 Yeah, too close.對啊，太靠近了。
2. dangerous 危險的。 The green light is way too short. 綠燈時間太短了. It's dangerous! 好危險。 I wonder if we can change the traffic lights.不知道我們能不能改變交通號誌。
3. traffic 交通。 Yeah, maybe traffic police can help us. 也許交通警察可以幫我們。
4. safe 安全的。 Yeah, let's ask them what we can do. 我們來問問他們我們可以做什麼。 They want to keep people safe too.他們也希望維護大家安全。

vocabulary.postscript: 你今天學到哪些單字? turn變成 dangerous危險的 traffic交通 safe安全的

quiz.question: 1. What animal does Chiayi use for its traffic light?
2. What does the little green man do in Taipei?
3. What city's lights have a little green man and his girlfriend?

title: A Man Builds Homes for People Who Need One

content.en: Some people live in big houses. Other people live in small apartments. Some people live on boats! There are many kinds of homes!
content.tw: 世界上有各式各樣的家，像是豪宅或是小公寓，有一些人甚至住在船上!

content.en: But some people don't have a home. They are homeless. They sleep on the street. Or they sleep in tents in parks. They are cold in the winter. They get wet when it rains. They have a hard life.
content.tw: 不過，也有一些人無家可歸，他們睡在路邊或是公園裡的帳篷，冬天或是雨天都一樣。他們的生活很辛苦。

content.en: Canada's winters are very cold and wet. A man there is helping people who are homeless. He's building homes for them. The homes are very small. They are easy to move with a bicycle!
content.tw: 加拿大的冬天非常冷，所以有個人正在為這些人製造房子。這些房子很小很輕，可以用腳踏車搬運。

content.en: These homes are made of strong plastic. They are warm in the winter. Rain can't come in. They're cool in the summer. There's a fan!
content.tw: 這些房子是用堅固的塑膠做的，可以抵擋寒風跟雨水，夏天時也很涼爽!

content.en: The homes have lights! There's a comfortable bed and a desk. There's a sink and a small toilet! And they're safe. The door has a lock!
content.tw: 房子裡什麼都有，有燈光、床、書桌跟廁所，它的門上有鎖，所以也十分安全!

content.en: It takes the man two months to build one home. He wants to build many more.
content.tw: 他花了兩個月做好第一間，還會繼續努力製造更多房子。

content.en: These small homes are safe and comfortable. Everyone needs a home. No one wants to be homeless!
content.tw: 這些小房子既安全又舒適。每個人都需要一個家。沒有人想無家可歸！

vocabulary.preface: 居住是人生重大課題，這位企業家決心幫忙。

content.text:
1. sleep 睡覺。
My friend is coming back from Canada for two weeks.
我的朋友要從加拿大回來兩個星期。
Can she sleep at your place in Taoyuan? 她能不能睡在你桃園的家?

2. bed 床。
No, sorry, my sister is staying there now.
不行，抱歉，我妹妹現在住在那兒。
It only has one bed. 只有一張床。

3. house 房子。
How about your house? 那你家呢?
My house?我家?
Why don't you let her sleep in your apartment? 你怎麼不讓她睡在你的公寓?
I can't.我不行。

4. toilet 馬桶。
There's only one toilet.那裏只有一個馬桶。
I can't share my toilet with others.我沒辦法跟別人共用馬桶。
You're weird, you know.妳很奇怪耶。

vocabulary.postscript:
這些是每天都用得到的單字。
sleep睡覺 bed床 house房子 toilet馬桶

quiz.question: 1. Why does the man build small homes?
options: a. To help people who are homeless
c. To make lots of money

quiz.question: 2. What do the small homes NOT have inside?
3. How long does it take the man to build one small home?

content.en: Worker: Someone left these empty cans in the elevator! Aargh! Who leaves their trash on the floor? Well, these cans are going into the trash can.
content.tw: 怎麼會有人把鋁罐留在電梯裡? 我把它們丟到垃圾桶吧!

content.en: Narrator: This happened at a museum in the Netherlands. But the empty cans were not trash. They were artwork!
content.tw: 這件事發生在荷蘭的美術館裡，兩個被丟掉的鋁罐其實是藝術品!

content.en: The artist worked hard on the artwork. He painted it for days and days. It looks like two empty beer cans. It's called "All the Good Times We Spent Together." It's about the artist's happy times with friends.
content.tw: 藝術家花了好幾天彩繪兩個鋁罐，命名為「我們的美好時光」，紀念跟朋友的開心回憶。

content.en: The museum is about food and drinks. It likes to surprise visitors. So the artwork was in a glass elevator. It was on the floor. A worker was fixing the elevator. He was new at the museum. He thought the artwork was trash!
content.tw: 這個美術館喜歡給觀眾驚喜，所以鋁罐被放在玻璃電梯的地板上展出。當修理電梯的工作人員看到時，他以為那是垃圾!

content.en: Other workers found the artwork in a trash can. Phew! They cleaned it carefully. They did not put it in the elevator again. Now the artwork is showing in a safer place.
content.tw: 好險其他工作人員在垃圾桶發現藝術品，把它們清洗乾淨後，移到更安全的地方展出。

content.en: Do you throw away the empty cans you see too? Well, it's good to pick up trash. But be careful! Maybe it's art!
content.tw: 你也會把看到的空罐子扔掉嗎？嗯，撿垃圾是好事。但要小心！也許那是藝術品呢！

vocabulary.preface: 藝術品被當成垃圾丟掉，只能怪它們放的地方不對。

content.text:
1. art 藝術。
Did you actually paint this? 你真的畫了這個?
I did. This is for my art project. 真的，這是我的藝術課作品。
So you call this art? 所以你把這個叫做藝術?
Oh yes, I spent days working on it. 是的，我花了好幾天做呢。

2. artist 藝術家。
But I'm definitely not an artist. 但我肯定不是藝術家。
No, I wouldn't say you are. 我也不會說你是。

3. throw away 扔掉。
So do you like it? 所以你喜歡它嗎?
Uh…Do I have to tell the truth? 我得講實話嗎?
Is it that bad? 有那麼糟糕嗎?
Yeah, I suggest you throw it away.對，我建議你把它扔掉。

4. hard 辛苦的。
Oh no! 不要。
Think of my hard work! 想想我的辛苦!
Okay, then keep it. 那你就保留吧。

vocabulary.postscript:
你喜歡看藝術展覽嗎?
art藝術 artist藝術家 throw away扔掉 hard辛苦的

quiz.question: 1. Where is the museum?
2. Why was the artwork thrown away?
options: a. Someone thought it was trash.
b. Someone thought it was art.
c. Someone thought it was clean.

quiz.question: 3. Who threw away the artwork?

content.en: Taiwan does well in weightlifting. Women weightlifters are very strong here. They won ten Olympic weightlifting medals. Taiwan has eleven. And now Taiwan has a new weightlifting whiz!
content.tw: 台灣的舉重女選手特別厲害，我們十一面的舉重奧運獎牌中，十面是由女選手贏得。現在又有一位新的舉重天才!

content.en: Chen Guan-ling is nineteen. She's a university student. She lifts in the 55-kilogram group. She's breaking many records! Two years ago, she was eighth at the world championships. Last year, she went back. She won all three gold medals!
content.tw: 才十九歲的陳冠伶，已經打破許多紀錄，兩年前，她在世界比賽得到第八名，去年她再度參賽，得了三個金牌，進步神速!

content.en: This year, she went to the junior world championships. She won all three gold medals! And she broke three records! Phew!
content.tw: 今年，她參加了青年世界錦標賽，又贏了三面世界金牌，並且刷新三項紀錄，好厲害!

content.en: Chen says she's had ups and downs. She says she's had lots of injuries. But thanks to her family and friends, she can keep lifting.
content.tw: 冠伶的運動生涯有高有低，也受過傷，不過在親友鼓勵下，她還是會持續努力。

content.en: Now Chen is at this year's world championships. She wants to break more records! Let's cheer for Chen Guan-ling, Taiwan's new record-breaking weightlifting whiz!
content.tw: 陳冠伶目前正在參加今年的世界錦標賽。她希望能打破更多紀錄！讓我們一起為這位台灣新的破紀錄舉重天才陳冠伶加油吧！

vocabulary.preface: 年輕的舉重選手陳冠伶表現傑出，屢次在國際比賽中獲得金牌。

content.text: 1. lift 舉起. Heading to the gym? 要去健身房? Yeah, I'm taking weight lifting classes now. 對，我現在有在上舉重課。
2. strong 強壯的. Good for you! 很好耶! I heard weight lifting can really make you strong. 我聽說重訓真的可以讓你變強壯. Yeah, that's what my doctor told me, too.我的醫生也這麼跟我說.
3. injury 受傷. He said a strong body means less injury. 他說強壯的身體可減少傷害.That's very true. 那是真的.
4. heavy 重的. Okay, the next time I need to move something heavy, 好，下次我要搬重東西, I'll call you. 就打電話給你. No problem.沒問題.

vocabulary.postscript: 你有看過舉重比賽嗎? lift 舉起 strong強壯的 injury受傷 heavy重的

quiz.question: 1. How many Olympic weightlifting medals did Taiwanese women win?
2. Who is Taiwan's 19-year-old weightlifter?
3. What does the weightlifter want to do at the world championships this year?

title: Nurse Finds New Way to Keep Baby Kangaroos Warm

content.en: Kangaroos live in Australia. They have strong back legs. They can jump!
content.tw: 澳洲住著很多袋鼠，牠們有強壯的後腿，很會跳!

content.en: In the wild, a baby kangaroo stays in its mother's pouch. The pouch is warm... But sometimes baby kangaroos get lost! Without their mothers, they cannot stay warm and healthy. They need help!
content.tw: 野外的袋鼠寶寶住在媽媽溫暖的育兒袋裡，但是假如牠們走失了怎麼辦?沒有媽媽，牠們體溫會降低，需要幫忙!

content.en: A rescue center helps sick or hurt kangaroos. It takes care of lost baby kangaroos too. But keeping them warm is hard.
content.tw: 袋鼠救援中心會照顧生病或是受傷的袋鼠，也照顧袋鼠寶寶。要如何保暖卻是個難題。

content.en: Incubators help keep human babies warm. Very small babies and some very sick babies need them. A hospital had new incubators. It didn't need its old incubators. But they still worked.
content.tw: 人類的小嬰兒剛出生時，會被放到保溫箱裡，剛好有一間醫院有一批不需要的舊保溫箱，不知道怎麼處理。

content.en: One day, a nurse saw a rescue worker with a baby kangaroo. The nurse had a great idea. Maybe the old incubators could help baby kangaroos!
content.tw: 有一天，一位護理師看到一個救援人員帶著一隻袋鼠寶寶，這位護理師想到個好主意﹑也許那些保溫箱可以幫助救援中心的袋鼠寶寶!

content.en: Thanks to the nurse, the rescue center has incubators. They are like mother kangaroo pouches! Baby kangaroos stay warm in them.
content.tw: 多虧那位護理師，現在救援中心多了這些保溫箱，可以保持袋鼠寶寶的溫暖。

content.en: Now more baby kangaroos can grow strong. And one day, they will go back to the wild!
content.tw: 現在更多袋鼠寶寶可以健康成長。總有一天，牠們會回到野外！

vocabulary.preface: 人類小嬰兒用的保溫箱，找不到媽媽的袋鼠寶寶也可以用。

content.text:
1) Australia 澳洲.
I'd like to visit Australia someday. 我想要哪天去澳洲玩。
To see koalas? 去看無尾熊?
Yeah, and kangaroos too. 對，還有袋鼠。

2) in the wild 在野外.
I hope to see a big mob of kangaroos in the wild.我希望在野外看到大群的袋鼠。
That shouldn't be hard. 那應該不難吧。

3) take care of 照顧.
It's not an endangered species.牠不是瀕危物種。
Taipei Zoo has kangaroos too, you know. 台北動物園也有袋鼠。
Are they well taken care of? 牠們受到很好照顧嗎?

4) jump 跳.
I think so.我想是。
They look happy, 牠們看起來滿快樂的，
and often jump around when I see them.常看到牠們跳來跳去。

vocabulary.postscript: 你去過澳洲嗎?Australia澳洲 in the wild在野外 take care of照顧 jump跳

quiz.question: 1. What keeps baby kangaroos warm in the wild?
2. What did the nurse think could help the baby kangaroos?
3. What do the baby kangaroos do one day?
options: c. Go back to the wild

content.en: Taiwan has a new kind of train. It's the orange and black E500! It made its first trip from Qidu Station in Keelung. It's the fourth kind of new train in ten years.
content.tw: 台灣新的火車出現囉! 橘色跟黑色相間的 E500，在基隆七堵站正式啟程。它是十年來的第四種新火車。

content.en: Ten years ago, many trains were old. Some were more than 40 years old! They were hard to take care of.
content.tw: 十年前，好多火車都超過了 40 歲，很老舊又好難照顧。

content.en: The train company has been working hard. They are making their train service better and better. Now there are 1,000 new train cars! Three hundred more train cars will come soon. All of these new train cars cost more than one hundred billion Taiwan dollars!
content.tw: 火車公司很努力地改善，現在他們有 1000 台新火車，未來還會有其他 300 台，這些火車總共花了超過 1000 億台幣!天啊!

content.en: The newest trains have a strong electric engine. They go fast and slow down fast. This makes train travel faster. It also helps trains to be on time. That makes train travel better!
content.tw: 這些新的火車有強大的電力引擎，它們速度很快，也能很快停下來，這樣火車可以很準時抵達，讓旅行更方便。

content.en: The train company had an event for the E500. It was at Qidu Station. Many people came! They took many pictures! A shop there had train cards, model trains, train key rings, and more!
content.tw: 火車公司在七堵辦了一個慶祝 E500 啟程的活動，吸引很多鐵道迷來拍照，現場還有很多火車相關的紀念品!

content.en: What an exciting time for train fans in Taiwan!
content.tw: 對台灣的鐵道迷來說，這真是令人興奮的時刻！

vocabulary.preface: 新的火車紛紛出現，讓旅行更方便而且舒適。

content.text: 1. travel 旅行。I need to go to Taitung next week.我星期需要去台東。I've never been there before. 我從來沒去那裏。Will you travel there by train? 你會搭火車去嗎?I hope so. 我希望。
2. electric 電的。I love taking the train. 我喜歡搭火車。Me too. Especially the new electric train.我也是，特別是新的電動火車。
3. on time 準時。My meeting starts at 9 AM. 我的會議早上九點開始。Do you think I can get there on time? 你覺得我可以準時到嗎?From Taipei? No. 從台北嗎?到不了。
4. fast 快的。Oh, so the train is not going fast enough. 所以火車跑得不夠快。

vocabulary.postscript: 來一起讀單字。travel旅行 electric電的 on time準時 fast快的

quiz.question: 1. Where did the new train make the first trip from?
2. What kind of engine does the newest train have?
3. What is one way Taiwan's train service is better?

content.en: 3D printers can make small plastic things. They can print key rings, whistles, and many other things. But some 3D printers can print big things!
content.tw: 3D 列印大部分用來做小東西，像是塑膠鑰匙圈或是哨子，但其實也可以列印出巨大的東西!

content.en: In the U.S., there is a very big 3D printer. It's five meters tall! It's fourteen meters wide! It weighs four thousand five hundred kilograms! That's about 140 kids in 5th and 6th grade!
content.tw: 在美國，有一台非常大的 3D 印表機，它 5 公尺高，14 公尺寬，重達4500 公斤，是 140 個五六年級學生加起來的重量!

content.en: Why is it so big? Well, that printer is printing a hotel! It is the first 3D printed hotel in the world. But it isn't made of plastic. It's made of cement.
content.tw: 為什麼這台印表機這麼大呢? 因為需要用它來列印一座飯店! 這是世界第一間用3D印表機列印出來的飯店，而且是用水泥做的。

content.en: Cement for 3D printers is very strong. The hotel buildings are round. They have domes and arches.
content.tw: 從3D 印表機出來的是水泥，飯店建築是圓形的，還有圓頂和拱形結構。

content.en: The 3D printed hotel has 43 rooms. But the rooms are not in one building. Each room is a small building! There is one printer. That's a lot of printing to do!
content.tw: 這座飯店有 43 個房間，每個房間都是獨立一棟建築，全部的工作都靠一台印表機列印!

content.en: The hotel opens in 2026. Do you want to go to this printed hotel?
content.tw: 這間飯店將於2026年開幕。你想去這間列印的飯店嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 3D印表機，已經進步到可以用來建造房屋。

content.text:
1. print 印。
The things that 3D printers can print are amazing!
3D印表機能列印的東西真驚人!
Like what? 比如說哪些?
A human heart or a liver. 人的心臟，或是肝臟。

2. thing 東西。
But are they any good? 但是那些好嗎?
I don't think I'd use the things made by a printer!
我想我不會用印表機做出的東西!

3. make 製作或是製造。
I don't know if they're good. 我不知道它們好不好。
But they can be made. 但是做得出來。

4. small 小的。
I think 3D printers should be used for small things only.
我覺得應該只用3D印表機做小東西。
Like shoes or glasses. 比如說鞋子或是眼鏡。

vocabulary.postscript:
你有看過3D印表機嗎?
print印 thing東西 make製作或是製造 small小的

quiz.question: 1. How tall is the 3D printer?
2. What is the 3D printed hotel made of?
3. When does the 3D printed hotel open?

content.en: Do you want to pay $120,000 Taiwan dollars for something... and then let it go?
content.tw: 你願意花 12 萬元買個東西，然後馬上放棄它嗎?

content.en: That's what a man in Taiwan did. He bought a very big sea snail. This sea snail lives deep in the sea. It is very rare. Its shell is orange, red, and green. Some people want this big, beautiful shell.
content.tw: 一名台灣男子就這麼做。他買了一個住在深海裡的巨大海螺，俗稱龍宮貝，它很稀有，身上是橘色、紅色跟綠色，很多人想要牠漂亮的殼。

content.en: A fisherman caught this sea snail near Turtle Island. He took it home. He put it in cold water. He told people he was selling it.
content.tw: 龍宮貝是漁夫在龜山島附近捕捉到的，並且帶回家用冷水維持生命，還跟大家宣傳要把它賣掉。

content.en: One person wanted to give him $160,000 Taiwan dollars. Did the fisherman take it? Nope. He sold it for less money! The fisherman sold it to a man for $120,000 Taiwan dollars. Why? Well, the man wanted the sea snail to live in the sea again.
content.tw: 有人最高出價到 16 萬台幣，但最後漁夫寧願賣給出價 12 萬元的男子，因為那名男子說，他買的原因是想把龍宮貝放回海裡!

content.en: So the fisherman took the sea snail out on his boat. The fisherman took pictures for the man. The sea snail went back into the sea!
content.tw: 於是漁夫把龍宮貝帶回龜山島附近，讓牠回歸大海，並且把過程照相給男子看。

content.en: What a good man! And what a lucky sea snail!
content.tw: 真是個好男人！這隻海螺也真幸運！

vocabulary.preface: 男子買下稀有龍宮貝，只是為了讓牠重返家園。

content.text:
1. shell 貝殼。
Look at the shell I found! 你看我找到的這個貝殼!
Wow, it's so beautiful! 哇，真漂亮!
I've never seen anything like this.我從來沒看過這種。

2. rare 稀有的
Me neither.我也沒有。
It must be pretty rare.一定是滿稀有的。
How did it end up here? 它怎麼會跑到這裡來?

3. sea 大海。
For that, you have to ask the sea.這個答案得問大海。
The sea can bring a lot of stuff to the shore. 海浪可以把很多東西帶到岸邊。

4. give 給予。
You may be right. 也許你是對的。
But can you give this to me? 但是你可以把它給我嗎?
I want to look it up in my book. 我要查一查我的書。
I can lend it to you.我可以借給你。

vocabulary.postscript:
你可記得今天的單字?
shell貝殼 rare稀有的 sea大海 give給予

quiz.question: 1. What did the fisherman do with the sea snail?
2. How many Taiwan dollars did a man pay for the sea snail?
3. What did the man want the sea snail to do?

title: Taipei Zoo Makes Typhoon Wood Furniture

content.en: Woah! Typhoons are dangerous! They damage houses, mountains, trees, and more. But sometimes a good thing can come from typhoons!
content.tw: 大家都知道颱風很危險，會摧毀房子跟山林，但是偶爾颱風會帶來好事!

content.en: In Taiwan, a big typhoon damaged a lot of trees. The wind blew very hard. Leaves flew away! Big branches broke! Some trees fell!
content.tw: 今年好幾個颱風帶來強風，很多樹木連根拔起，樹葉樹枝散落一地。

content.en: After the typhoon, Yilan had lots of wood from these trees. It was on beaches and near rivers. People were cleaning it up. But what could be done with it? Well, Taipei Zoo had a good idea!
content.tw: 颱風過後，宜蘭溪流附近有很多漂流木，該拿它們怎麼辦呢? 台北木柵動物園有個好主意!

content.en: The zoo got lots of wood from Yilan. It used the wood to make new furniture! Did the zoo make beds, tables, and chairs? Hmmm … this furniture is different. It's for the animals! They use the wood from the typhoon in many ways.
content.tw: 動物園拿那些木頭來做家具，當然不是做成床、桌子跟椅子。其實這些木頭是要改造給動物使用的!

content.en: Otters sleep on new wood beds. They play with the wood too. Rhinos scratch their horns with it. Koalas and pandas climb on it. The animals love the new wood!
content.tw: 海獺把木頭當作睡覺的床，犀牛用它們磨自己的角，無尾熊跟貓熊在上面爬上爬下，動物們都愛死了這些木頭家具!

content.en: Thanks to Taipei Zoo's idea, its animals are happier! Go to the zoo. Look for the typhoon wood furniture! It's there, there, and there!
content.tw: 多虧了台北市立動物園的巧思，牠們的動物都更快樂了！去動物園看看那些颱風木製家具吧！它們就在那裡、那裡、還有那裡！

vocabulary.preface: 漂流木很有用，可以做成動物園的家具。

content.text: 1. fall 倒下. This park seems different. 這個公園好像不一樣了。 It is different.是不一樣。 Lots of trees fell in the last typhoon.上次颱風倒了好多樹。
2. leaf 樹葉. That's heartbreaking! 真讓人心痛! Yeah, branches and leaves blew everywhere! 對啊，樹枝和樹葉吹得到處都是。
3. clean up 清乾淨. So they were all cleaned up? 所以都清乾淨了? Yeah, soldiers came and cleared them away. 對，阿兵哥來都清理了。
4. chair 椅子. But I took a big branch home. 不過我帶了一根大樹枝回家。 I'm thinking of using it as a chair. 我想把它用來當椅子。 For your farm? 給你的農場? For my little farm.給我的小農場。

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字你記住了嗎? fall倒下 leaf樹葉 clean up清乾淨 chair椅子

quiz.question: 1. What did the typhoon do to the trees?
options: c. Blew them to the zoo

quiz.question: 2. Where did the wood come from?
3. What was the wood used for?

content.en: The seeds for the food we grow are important. A seed bank in Norway keeps seeds safe for the world. This year, Taiwan sent one hundred and seventy kinds of millet seeds there!
content.tw: 種子對我們的食物很重要。挪威有個種子銀行，保存世界各地的種子。今年，台灣送了一百七十種小米種子到那裡。

content.en: Taiwan has its own seed bank too. And people here also keep seeds safe. In one village, the Bunun people work hard to keep their beans safe. Beans are part of their culture.
content.tw: 台灣也有自己的種子銀行。在一個布農族的聚落，人們努力保存豆子，因為那對他們的文化很重要。

content.en: The Bunun eat many kinds of beans. But some were almost lost before. So they grow every kind every year now.
content.tw: 布農族人吃各種各樣的豆子，不過有一些品種幾乎滅絕。因此，他們現在每年都會種植每一種豆類。

content.en: Older Bunun farmers love to grow beans. Before, farmers kept their family's beans safe. But now, they have a bean club. They share their beans. They teach everyone about them. There are 28 kinds!
content.tw: 以前，農夫會保護自家特有的豆類。現在，他們成立社團，互相分享豆子種類，總共有28 種，並教導布農族人有關豆子的知識。

content.en: Now, younger Bunun people also help keep beans safe. At a school, Bunun students learn about beans. They grow beans and eat them there. They learn about their culture.
content.tw: 年輕的布農學生也學習豆子的知識，並練習種植，了解布農族的文化。

content.en: The Bunun work together to keep their beans safe. Their children and their children's children will enjoy many kinds of beans. They will know about their culture!
content.tw: 布農族人齊心協力保護他們的豆子。他們的子子孫孫將會享用多種豆類，並了解他們的文化！

vocabulary.preface: 布農族人重視他們的農作物，並且教導年輕人相關知識。

content.text:
1. grow 種植。
The green beans you gave me taste great! 你送我的四季豆很好吃! Are they easy
to grow? 容不容易種?
They are. But they need lots of sunshine. 很容易，不過需要大量日光。

2. this year 今年。
I'm planning to have a roof garden this year. 我打算今年弄個屋頂菜園。That'll
be perfect for growing vegetables.那兒種蔬菜最好了。

3. seed 種子。
Where can I get the seeds? 我在哪裡可以得到種子?
You can find a lot of seed stores in Changhua. 你可以在彰化找到很多種子店。

4. eat 吃。
I'm excited! 我好興奮! I want to grow beans, tomatoes, peppers…
我要種四季豆，番茄，青椒....
And I'll eat them.我會把它們吃掉。

vocabulary.postscript: 你喜歡哪一種蔬菜? 來一起讀單字。grow種植 this year今年 seed種子 eat吃

quiz.question: 1. What does a seed bank do?
2. What does the bean club do?
3. In one village, what do the Bunun have 28 kinds of?

title: What Will Be the Toys of the Year?

content.en: Making a new toy sounds fun. But it's hard to do. Inventors think about the toy. They think about the kids who will play with it. Is the toy too easy or too hard for the kids?
content.tw: 發明新的玩具聽起來很有趣，但其實不簡單。發明家要思考玩具會不會太難?小朋友會喜歡嗎?

content.en: Inventors make one sample of their toy. They take the sample to kids to play with. Do kids like it? Then the inventor tests the toy. Does it break easily? Does it have dangerous parts?
content.tw: 發明家會先做出一個樣本，看看小孩喜不喜歡，然後檢查玩具是否堅固，會不會危險?

content.en: When there are no more problems, a toy factory makes a lot of the toy. Then the inventor needs to sell them! Phew! It takes lots of work to make a new toy! But... maybe kids around the world will play with it!
content.tw: 確認沒有問題之後，廠商製造這件玩具，發明家還要想辦法把它賣掉!發明新玩具還真累人，不過可以帶給世界很多小孩快樂。

content.en: Every year, toy inventors hope their toy gets a Toy Foundation award. Toys that get the most votes win. Everyone can vote on the foundation's website.
content.tw: 每一年，發明家都希望自己做的玩具，能得到玩具基金會大獎，每一個人都可以上網投票!

content.en: You can vote for sixteen kinds of toys. There are action figures, stuffed animals, toys that help you make things your own way, toys that teach, and more!
content.tw: 你可以決定你最喜歡的可動公仔、絨毛玩具、帶你動手做東西的玩具等等，總共有 16 個種類可以選!

content.en: You can vote until January tenth! Good luck, inventors!
content.tw: 你可以投票直到一月十日！祝發明家們好運！

vocabulary.preface: 玩具發明家的工作很不簡單，卻很有趣。

content.text: 1. stuffed toy 絨毛動物玩具。What's your favorite toy when you were little? 你小時候最喜歡的玩具是什麼?My Billy the shepherd dog. 比利，我的牧羊犬。A stuffed animal? 一隻絨毛動物?Yeah, it's very cute!對，它很可愛!
2. play 玩耍。What about you? 那你呢?Oh, I loved my small chairs and tables. 我喜歡我的小桌子小椅子。I played with them all the time.我經常玩。
3. fun 好玩的。Those toys were so much fun! 那些玩具真好玩!Much better than the toys that kids get today. 比現在小孩的玩具好多了。
4. make 製造。They should make more simple but interesting toys.他們應該多做簡單有趣的玩具。Yeah, instead of just computer games. 對啊，而不是只有電腦遊戲。

vocabulary.postscript: 這些單字你記住了嗎?stuffed toy絨毛動物玩具 play玩耍 fun好玩的 make製造

quiz.question: 1. What can happen after there are no more problems with a new toy?
options: a. A factory makes lots of it.
c. The inventor makes a sample.

quiz.question: 2. How many kinds of toys can you vote for?
3. When does voting stop?
